title: $:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field
name: Smart Field
description: Generate a Field editing Form, based on Tag and Ontology on your tiddler.
author: LinOnetwo
text:
{"tiddlers":{"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/FormTag":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/FormTag","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"!! Form Tag

Adding `$:/tags/Ontology/Form` to your tiddler means this tiddler, when used as a tag, will provide a form for your tagged tiddler.

Fields are defined with `properties.xxx: ontologyName` fields, it will define the `xxx` field for the tiddler, and field type is defined in the `ontologyName`.

!! Example

This plugin will look for fields like `properties.xxx`, they describes what field found will show up in our user's tiddler.

```tid
tags: $:/tags/Ontology/Form
properties.favoritePhoneBrand: sfeo
properties.phoneNumber: sfeo
```

The `sfeo` in the example is an `ontologyName`, see [[$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ontologyDeveloper]] for how ontology works.
"},"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ontologyDeveloper":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ontologyDeveloper","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"!! Detailed explanation for Ontology Developers

You will use `$:/tags/Ontology` and `$:/tags/Ontology/Field` tags in your ontology plugin. And your plugin name should start with `$:/plugins/ontology/` and ends with a short-hand of your ontology name.

!!! Short-Hand

We use short-hand so using ontology name in the field is easier. For example, Task Management Ontology's plugin name will be `$:/plugins/ontology/tmo`, and field using it will be like `properties.dateTime: tmo`.

!!! A Todo example

For example,

```tid
title: Todo
tags: $:/tags/Ontology
properties.phoneNumber: sfeo


Here are the text field of tiddler, contains some readme content about this tag.
```

this ontology-tag-tiddler will look for the definition in [[$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo]] and will try to read the definition in [[$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo/phoneNumber]].

The content of [[$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo/phoneNumber]] is a JSONSchema fragment (usually this is manually rewritten from ontology's RDF definition to JSON), and the tag of :

```tid
title: $:/plugins/ontology/sfeo/phoneNumber
tags: $:/tags/Ontology/Field

{
  "type": "string",
  "format": "tw-date-time"
}
```
"},"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/pluginMaintainer":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/pluginMaintainer","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"!! Used technology

!!! The widget part, located in `form.ts`

This plugin depends on tw-react plugin, and is using [[https://rjsf-team.github.io/react-jsonschema-form/]].

!!! The data source part, located in `getProps` method of `FormWidget`

We use a filter to get tags of current tiddler:

# filter tags of currentTiddler with `$:/tags/Ontology` tag
# filter their fields that point to an ontology plugin tiddler
# get JSONSchema definition fragment from the ontology plugin tiddler
# put fragments together to make a form Schema string, return to the filter caller

And we pass the form Schema string to the react-jsonschema-form, it will generate a form for us automatically. As you can see, this is a ReactJS component, so we rely on [[$:/plugins/linonetwo/tw-react]] plugin to make it works.

!!! Developer Tool part

$:/tags/Ontology/Field makes its content editable and presentable via JSONSchemaForm

!! Form widget

More widgets:

* https://github.com/RXNT
"},"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/user":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/user","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":""},"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/Example":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/Example","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","tags":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ExampleFormTag","text":"!! Example

We have add [[$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ExampleFormTag]] to get our form.

You will see form appear on the bottom â†“
"},"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ExampleFormTag":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ExampleFormTag","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","tags":"$:/tags/Ontology/Form","properties.favoritePhoneBrand":"sfeo","properties.phoneNumber":"sfeo","text":"!! Example Ontology

This is an example [[FormTag|$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/FormTag]] that will make tiddler with this tag have some field forms.

"},"$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo/favoritePhoneBrand":{"title":"$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo/favoritePhoneBrand","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","tags":"$:/tags/Ontology/Field","text":"{
  "type": "string",
  "title": "Favorite Phone Brand",
  "minLength": 2,
  "enum": [
    "XiaoMi",
    "iPhone",
    "WinPhone",
    "Oppo",
    "Nokia"
  ]
}"},"$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo/phoneNumber":{"title":"$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo/phoneNumber","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","tags":"$:/tags/Ontology/Field","text":"{
  "title": "Phone Number",
  "type": "integer"
}"},"$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo":{"title":"$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","tags":"$:/tags/Ontology","text":"!! Example Ontology

This is an example "Ontology" that is for demo about what an Ontology plugin looks like.

See [[the doc for ontologyDevelopers|$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ontologyDeveloper]] for details.

!!! SFEO

"sfeo" is short for "smart-field-example-ontology", we use short-hand so using ontology name in the field is easier.

","type":"application/javascript","module-type":"widget"},"/home/runner/work/tiddlywiki-plugins/tiddlywiki-plugins/dist/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/form.ts":{"title":"/home/runner/work/tiddlywiki-plugins/tiddlywiki-plugins/dist/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/form.ts","text":"import { withTheme, IChangeEvent } from '@rjsf/core';
import { Theme as Mui5Theme } from '@rjsf/material-ui';
import type { JSONSchema6 } from 'json-schema';
import debounce from 'lodash/debounce';
import isEqual from 'lodash/isEqual';
import { ITiddlerFields } from 'tiddlywiki';
import type { ReactWidget } from 'tw-react';

// Make modifications to the theme with your own fields and widgets
const Form = withTheme(Mui5Theme);

const Widget = require('$:/plugins/linonetwo/tw-react/widget.js').widget as typeof ReactWidget;

const log = (type: string) => console.log.bind(console, type);
const DEBOUNCE_DELAY = 1000;

class FormWidget extends Widget {
  reactComponent = Form;
  getProps = () => {
    const currentTiddler = this.getAttribute('tiddler', this.getVariable('currentTiddler'));
    const formData = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(currentTiddler)?.fields ?? {};
    /** Found "form tags" of the current tiddler, we will read their fields to get fields that will show up in our user's tiddler. */
    const formTagsFilter: string = `${currentTiddler} +[tags[]tag[$:/tags/Ontology/Form]]`;
    // run filter to get tags. If !currentTiddler, then there will be filter error, we skip the filter run.
    const formTags: string[] = !!currentTiddler ? $tw.wiki.compileFilter(formTagsFilter)() : [];
    // prepare ontology names we need to find
    /**
     * Fields that will show in user's tiddler, and each field's ontology name.
     */
    const formFieldsAndOntologies: { field: string; ontology: string }[] = formTags.flatMap((tiddlerTitle) => {
      const fields = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(tiddlerTitle)?.fields;
      if (!fields) {
        return [];
      }
      /** We will look for fields like `properties.xxx` */
      return Object.keys(fields)
        .filter((fieldName) => fieldName.startsWith('properties.') && fields[fieldName])
        .map((fieldName) => {
          const ontologyName = fields[fieldName] as string;
          const finalFieldName = fieldName.replace('properties.', '');
          return { field: finalFieldName, ontology: ontologyName };
        });
    });
    // get JSONSchema from the ontology, using ontologyName.fieldName
    const schema: JSONSchema6 = {
      type: 'object',
      required: [],
      properties: {
        // title: { type: 'string', title: 'Title', default: 'A new task' },
        // done: { type: 'boolean', title: 'Done?', default: false },
      },
    };
    formFieldsAndOntologies.forEach(({ field, ontology }) => {
      /**
       * A tiddler tagged with `$:/tags/Ontology/Field`
       */
      const ontologyFieldTiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(`$:/plugins/ontology/${ontology}/${field}`)?.fields;
      if (!ontologyFieldTiddler?.tags?.includes('$:/tags/Ontology/Field')) {
        return;
      }
      /**
       * JSONSchema in tiddler's text field
       */
      const schemaFragmentOfThisField: string = ontologyFieldTiddler.text;
      try {
        const parsedSchema = JSON.parse(schemaFragmentOfThisField);
        schema.properties![field] = parsedSchema;
      } catch {
        // TODO: handle error and warn user about a bad form plugin installed
      }
    });
    const debouncedOnChange = debounce((data: IChangeEvent) => {
      const prevFields = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(currentTiddler)?.fields ?? ({} as ITiddlerFields);
      // prevent useless call to addTiddler
      if (Object.keys(data.formData).length === 0 || isEqual(data.formData, prevFields)) {
        return;
      }
      $tw.wiki.addTiddler({ ...prevFields, ...data.formData });
    }, DEBOUNCE_DELAY);
    return {
      schema,
      formData: formFieldsAndOntologies.length > 0 ? formData : {},
      children: null,
      onChange: debouncedOnChange,
      // onSubmit: log('submitted'),
      // onError: log('errors'),
    };
  };
}
exports.formWidget = FormWidget;
","type":".ts"},"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/readme":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/readme","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"!! Background

I hope there can be a standard way to encourage plugin developers to use similar field name in their plugins, so different plugins can be used together on a same set of data. See [[Suggestion for all Plugin developers about field name: Letâ€™s use Ontology to maintain Interoperability|https://talk.tiddlywiki.org/t/suggestion-for-all-plugin-developers-about-field-name-lets-use-ontology-to-maintain-interoperability/1923]] for the discussion.

!! Example

Open [[$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/Example]] to see the form provided by the [[example FormTag|$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ExampleFormTag]] and the example [[Ontology|$:/plugins/ontology/sfeo]].

!! Basic Usage

!!! Display form in your tiddler

Just add some [[FormTag|$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/FormTag]] to your wiki. You can try adding `$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ExampleFormTag` to try out!

!!! Add new form fields

Read [[FormTag|$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/FormTag]] document to learn about how to create your own tag that will add form to tiddler when added to a tiddler.

If you are going to create an ontology tag that can add field form to user's tiddler, you can read [[$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/ontologyDeveloper]].

!! Plugin Developer

See [[$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/pluginMaintainer]] for how this plugin works.
"},"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/style.css":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/style.css","text":".rjsf > div > button.btn {
  display: none;
}
form.rjsf {
  line-height: 0px;
}
/* make form compact */
.MuiGrid-item {
  padding: 0px !important;
  margin: 0px !important;
}
","creator":"LinOnetwo","tags":"$:/tags/Stylesheet","type":"text/css"},"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/infobar":{"title":"$:/plugins/linonetwo/smart-field/infobar","tags":"$:/tags/ViewTemplate","type":"text/vnd.tiddlywiki","text":"<$formWidget />
"}}}
